sen.j: 宮下 太吉（みやした たきち、1875年9月30日 - 1911年1月24日）は無政府主義者。
sen.e: Takichi MIYASHITA (September 30, 1875 - January 24, 1911) is a known anarchist.
Takichi MIYASHITA (September 30, 1875 - January 24, 1911) was an anarchist.
sen.cmt: is→was としました。known を削除しました。
sen.e: Takichi MIYASHITA (September 30, 1875 - January 24, 1911) was an anarchist.

sen.j: 1909年、愛知県知多郡半田町（現・半田市）の鉄工所から長野県東筑摩郡中川手村（現・安曇野市）の「明科製材所」にヘッドハントされて移り、当地で明治天皇を暗殺するためとして爆弾を試作したという。
sen.e: In 1909, he was head-hunted to transfer from a steel mill in Handa-cho, Chita County, Aichi Prefecture (currently Handa City) to "Meika Lumber mill" in Nakagawate Village, Higashichikuma County, Nagano Prefecture, (currently Azumino City) and there he was presumably engaged in the experimental production of a bomb to assassinate Meiji Emperor.

In 1909, he was head-hunted to transfer from a steel mill in Handa-cho, Chita County, Aichi Prefecture (currently Handa City) to 'Meika Lumber mill' in Nakagawate Village, Higashichikuma County, Nagano Prefecture (currently Azumino City), and there he was presumably engaged in the experimental production of a bomb to assassinate Meiji Emperor.
sen.cmt: シングルクオーテーションに変更しました。コンマを括弧の後に移動しました。
sen.e: In 1909, he was head-hunted to transfer from a steel mill in Handa-cho, Chita County, Aichi Prefecture (currently Handa City) to 'Meika Lumber mill' in Nakagawate Village, Higashichikuma County, Nagano Prefecture (currently Azumino City), and there he was presumably engaged in the experimental production of a bomb to assassinate Meiji Emperor.

sen.j: 1910年5月25日、爆発物取締罰則違反の容疑により長野県で逮捕され（明科事件）、宮下は菅野スガ、新村忠雄、古河力作らと共に天皇暗殺の構想を抱いていたとされ、数人は幸徳秋水を首領に天皇暗殺を企てたとして大逆事件の端緒を開いた。
sen.e: On May 25, 1910, he was arrested for the suspicion of violating the regulation on handling explosive in Nagano Prefecture, (it is called Meika Incident) while the police also considered Miyashita had assassination plan of Meiji Emperor along with some other members, including Suga KANNO, Tadao NIIMURA, Rikisaku FURUKAWA; consequently this incident was considered to be the beginning point of High Treason Incident led by Shusui KOTOKU, plotting a scheme of assassinating Emperor.
sen.cmt: 対訳で古河を「こが」とされていますが、Wikipediaの項目では「ふるかわ」となっています。「新村忠雄」の項目でも同様の間違いがあります。
sen.e: On May 25, 1910, he was arrested for the suspicion of violating the Explosives Control Act in Nagano Prefecture (it is called Meika Incident), while the police also considered Miyashita had assassination plan of Meiji Emperor along with some other members, including Suga KANNO, Tadao NIIMURA, Rikisaku FURUKAWA; consequently this incident triggered the High Treason Incident with suspicion that some of them had plotted to assassinate the Emperor under the leadership of Shusui KOTOKU.
sen.cmt: the regulation on handling explosive→the Explosives Control Act としました。コンマを括弧の前から後に移動しました。High Treason Incident の前に the を追加しました。大逆事件は幸徳による天皇暗殺計画そのもののことではないため（その発覚に伴う弾圧事件のこと <広辞苑より>）、訳しなおしました。原文「数人は」の示す範囲がはっきりわかりませんでしたが、天皇暗殺の構想を抱いていたうちの数人が、改めて幸徳と天皇暗殺を企てたと解釈して訳出しました。
sen.e: On May 25, 1910 (in what has become known as the Meika Incident), Miyashita was arrested in Nagano Prefecture on suspicion of violating the Explosives Control Act, and on suspicion that Miyashita and his associates, including Suga KANNO, Tadao NIIMURA, Rikisaku FURUKAWA, were planning to assassinate the Meiji Emperor; this incident subsequently triggered the High Treason Incident, due to the suspicion that some of them had plotted to assassinate the Emperor under the leadership of Shusui KOTOKU.

sen.j: 幸徳や宮下らは死刑となり、1911年1月24日午後12時16分に処刑される。
sen.e: KOTOKU and MIYASHITA were sentenced to death, and the execution was carried out on January 24, 1911, at 12:16PM.
Kotoku and Miyashita were sentenced to death, and the execution was carried out on January 24, 1911, at 12:16PM.

sen.j: 山梨県では1906年（明治39年）に宮崎民蔵や日本社会党を結成する堺利彦、森近運平らが来県して社会主義や無政府主義を紹介した。
sen.e: Tamizo MIYAZAKI, and Toshihiko SAKAI and Unpei MORICHIKA who later established Japan Socialist Party, visited Yamanashi Prefecture in 1906 to introduce socialism and anarchism movements, while Yamanashi Prefecture also sought for social reformation and succeeded to win the endorsement of those people of high repute in the region, along with certain number of people joining the party mainly from tenant farmer class; however, the movement withered up on the damage of severe flood hit the region in 1907, and also on the suppression of High Treason Incident.
